brief_description: This study is a multicenter, non-randomized, retrospective study to collect long term (5 years posttransplant +/- 6 months) clinical outcome data on subjects previously enrolled in the CTOT-01 study.
brief_title: A Retrospective Multicenter Study to Determine 5-Year Clinical Outcomes in Subjects Previously Enrolled in the CTOT-01 Study (CTOT-17)
description: This study is a multicenter, non-randomized, retrospective study to collect long term (5 years posttransplant +/- 6 months) clinical outcome data on subjects previously enrolled in the CTOT-01 study.
endpoints: The primary endpoint is change in eGFR (MDRD in the adult cohort and Schwartz method in the pediatric cohort) from 6 months to 5 years post-transplantation. The following secondary endpoints will be measured: 1. Patient survival as assessed by the incidence of death reported in the first 5 years posttransplant. 2. Graft survival as assessed by the incidence of graft loss reported in the first 5 years posttransplant. 3. Renal function as assessed by the absolute GFR at 5 years post-transplant. 4. Change in Chronic Kidney Disease stages between transplant and 5 years posttransplant.
hypothesis: This study will test whether the results of the noninvasive immune monitoring test strategy performed in the parent study (CTOT-01) in first six-month post-transplant is predictive of 5-year outcomes.
objectives: The primary objective is to evaluate whether the absence of urinary chemokine markers at 6-months post-transplant correlates with better kidney function at 5 years posttransplant independent of the selected clinical variables. The secondary objective is to evaluate whether the absence of urinary chemokine markers at 6-months post-transplant correlates with better clinical outcomes (i.e., patient survival, graft survival, and renal function) at 5 years post transplant.
official_title: A Retrospective Multicenter Study to Determine 5-Year Clinical Outcomes in Subjects Previously Enrolled in the CTOT-01 Study

personnel.organization: Mount Sinai School of Medicine, Ricanati Miller Transplant Institute

pubmed.title: Analysis of Biomarkers Within the Initial 2 Years Posttransplant and 5-Year Kidney Transplant Outcomes: Results From Clinical Trials in Organ Transplantation-17.

program.contract_name: NONINVASIVE MARKERS AND TRANSPLANT OUTCOME IN HUMANS (CTOT-01, CTOT-05)
